title: Bennu

| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A sacred, self-created sunbird, representative of rebirth. It has ascended past the cycles of life and death, and calls upon aspects of both, rising forth from death in a burst of unholy flame. |

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [3 Trivia](#Trivia)
- [4 History](#History)

## Useful Info

**Bennu** are curiously contradictory creatures, masters of both life and death. Their attacks inflict [holy](/Holy "Holy") damage. Upon death, bennus resurrect and emit a large burst of negative energy, damaging the living. They can only resurrect once. They are very rare, appearing only in [the Tomb of the Ancients](/The_Tomb_of_the_Ancients "The Tomb of the Ancients") and [ziggurats](/Ziggurat "Ziggurat").

## Tips & Tricks

- For the living, bennu are one of the less dangerous Tomb creatures; they are simple melee threats that aren't especially strong. But against [undead](/Undead "Undead") or [demonic](/Demonspawn "Demonspawn") players, they can hit hard and fast with [holy](/Holy "Holy")-branded attacks. If you're vulnerable to holy and lack great defenses, mind the damage.
- Bennu are immune to [fire](/Fire "Fire") and resistant to [Shatter](/Shatter "Shatter"), so many AOE spells that obliterate mummies won't work against them.

## Trivia

The bennu is a reference to [Bennu](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bennu), an Egyptian deity of the sun, creation, and rebirth. The unholy aspects ascribed to it in *DCSS* have likely only been added to make it better fit in the undead-filled Tomb of the Ancients.

## History

- Prior to [0.30](/0.30 "0.30"), bennu had fast regeneration.
- Prior to [0.28](/0.28 "0.28"), they were [vulnerable to water](/Category:Water_vulnerability "Category:Water vulnerability").
- Prior to [0.19](/0.19 "0.19"), their [ghostly flame](/Ghostly_flame "Ghostly flame") explosions could heal any nearby undead, including the player. Also, bennu had a [draining](/Draining "Draining") melee attack.
- Bennu were added in [0.16](/0.16 "0.16"). For a brief time during their development, they also possessed [sticky flame](/Sticky_flame "Sticky flame") attacks.

Bennu

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.30: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
bennu b 
HP 50-103
HD 14
XP 1337
Speed 16
AC 6
EV 16
Will 140
Attack1 27 (peck: holy)
Attack2 24 (claw: plain)
Attack3 24 (claw: plain)
Resistances rF+++
rPois+
rMiasma
rN+++
Vulnerabilities None
Habitat Land
Intelligence Human
Uses Uses nothing
Holiness Natural
Size Medium
Type bennu, bennu
Flags See invisible
Flying
Speaks
Warm-blooded
No poly
A sacred, self-created sunbird, representative of rebirth. It has ascended past the cycles of life and death, and calls upon aspects of both, rising forth from death in a burst of unholy flame.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Tips & Tricks
  • 3 Trivia
  • 4 History

Useful Info

Bennu are curiously contradictory creatures, masters of both life and death. Their attacks inflict holy damage. Upon death, bennus resurrect and emit a large burst of negative energy, damaging the living. They can only resurrect once. They are very rare, appearing only in the Tomb of the Ancients and ziggurats.

Tips & Tricks

  • For the living, bennu are one of the less dangerous Tomb creatures; they are simple melee threats that aren't especially strong. But against undead or demonic players, they can hit hard and fast with holy-branded attacks. If you're vulnerable to holy and lack great defenses, mind the damage.
  • Bennu are immune to fire and resistant to Shatter, so many AOE spells that obliterate mummies won't work against them.

Trivia

The bennu is a reference to Bennu, an Egyptian deity of the sun, creation, and rebirth. The unholy aspects ascribed to it in DCSS have likely only been added to make it better fit in the undead-filled Tomb of the Ancients.

History

  • Prior to 0.30, bennu had fast regeneration.
  • Prior to 0.28, they were vulnerable to water.
  • Prior to 0.19, their ghostly flame explosions could heal any nearby undead, including the player. Also, bennu had a draining melee attack.
  • Bennu were added in 0.16. For a brief time during their development, they also possessed sticky flame attacks.

rawPage:
{{version030}}
{{monster info}}

==Useful Info==
'''Bennu''' are curiously contradictory creatures, masters of both life and death. Their attacks inflict [[holy]] damage. Upon death, bennus resurrect and emit a large burst of negative energy, damaging the living. They can only resurrect once. They are very rare, appearing only in [[the Tomb of the Ancients]] and [[ziggurat]]s.

==Tips & Tricks==
*For the living, bennu are one of the less dangerous Tomb creatures; they are simple melee threats that aren't especially strong. But against [[undead]] or [[Demonspawn|demonic]] players, they can hit hard and fast with [[holy]]-branded attacks. If you're vulnerable to holy and lack great defenses, mind the damage.
*Bennu are immune to [[fire]] and resistant to [[Shatter]], so many AOE spells that obliterate mummies won't work against them.

==Trivia==
The bennu is a reference to [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bennu Bennu], an Egyptian deity of the sun, creation, and rebirth. The unholy aspects ascribed to it in ''DCSS'' have likely only been added to make it better fit in the undead-filled Tomb of the Ancients.

==History==
*Prior to [[0.30]], bennu had fast regeneration.
*Prior to [[0.28]], they were [[:Category:Water_vulnerability|vulnerable to water]].
*Prior to [[0.19]], their [[ghostly flame]] explosions could heal any nearby undead, including the player. Also, bennu had a [[draining]] melee attack.
*Bennu were added in [[0.16]]. For a brief time during their development, they also possessed [[sticky flame]] attacks.
